pr_title: Use custom serialization and deserialization to flatten regexFlags.

timeline.bodyText: Should add some tests that target RegexFlagsUtils directly.
timeline.author: alzimmermsft

timeline.bodyText: This won't be null safe which is different behavior than before.
timeline.author: alzimmermsft

replies.bodyText: Yes, it will throw NPE. Is it better to make it silent if pass null?
replies.author: sima-zhu

replies.bodyText: null was an allowable configuration before, this changes it so that once this is set you can never clear it out.
replies.author: alzimmermsft

timeline.bodyText: This API may be better as setFlags(RegexFlags... flags).
timeline.author: alzimmermsft

replies.bodyText: The reason I choose this because we do not need to convert if passing RegexFlags.values()
replies.author: sima-zhu

replies.bodyText: Would this be a common scenario though? Also, I think this would be likely to fail as values() would contain all the unioned RegexFlags as well.
replies.author: alzimmermsft

replies.bodyText: @brjohnstmsft what does the service do if the same flag is passed multiple times.
replies.author: alzimmermsft

timeline.message: Initial draft for custom serializer and deserializer
Initial draft for custom serializer and deserializer

timeline.author: alzimmermsft

replies.bodyText: It is useless. Removed.
replies.author: sima-zhu

timeline.bodyText: What happens if this is called directly instead of being called through serializeWithType? Is it missing the start and end object pieces?
timeline.author: alzimmermsft

replies.bodyText:
For polymorphism type, it is asking to add TypeIndoName and TypeInfoId for differentiate the base and sub classes.
 ["@odata.type": "#Microsoft.Azure.Search.PatternAnalyzer" ] is added before serialize the rest. These info are inside of the para TypeSerializer
replies.author: sima-zhu

timeline.bodyText: Should any logic in here just be added into serialize and this acts as a proxy to serialize.
timeline.author: alzimmermsft

replies.bodyText:
Not really, the typeInfoId and typeInfoName is inside of TypeSerializer.
["@odata.type": "#Microsoft.Azure.Search.PatternAnalyzer" ]
replies.author: sima-zhu

timeline.bodyText: What happens if flattenFlags is null?
timeline.author: alzimmermsft

replies.bodyText: That's a miss. Will double check null cases for all.
replies.author: sima-zhu

timeline.bodyText: Does this need to live outside of the fields.hasNext() loop?
timeline.author: alzimmermsft

replies.bodyText: No. I forgot to move it into method
replies.author: sima-zhu

timeline.author: alzimmermsft

replies.bodyText: Then the check of  "stopwords".equals(field.getKey()) will return false.
replies.author: sima-zhu

replies.bodyText:
So if the JSON contains the following we'll never have a stopwords field?
{ "stopwords": null }
replies.author: alzimmermsft

timeline.author: alzimmermsft

replies.bodyText: Double checked code. field.getVaule returns iterator.
replies.author: sima-zhu

timeline.bodyText: Does this need to be escaped?
timeline.author: alzimmermsft

replies.bodyText: That's how String.split method works.
replies.author: sima-zhu

timeline.bodyText: What is the output when analyzer is null?
timeline.author: alzimmermsft

replies.bodyText:
I cannot have the case. Index.setAnalyzer takes list
There is no way to have a null PatternAnalyzer pass in.
I plan to remove it.
replies.author: sima-zhu

timeline.bodyText: Same questions as the other deserializer about flags being null and this needing to be outside of the JSON node loop.
timeline.author: alzimmermsft

timeline.bodyText: How does asInt() handle if getValue() is null? group is a nullable Integer type so it could come back as null from my understanding.
timeline.author: alzimmermsft

replies.bodyText:
I don't think the case exists.
If the field value is null, then there is no need to generate field key. If the case exists for required field, then we need to have null or empty checking for the field.
replies.author: sima-zhu

timeline.author: alzimmermsft

timeline.message: Make changes for corner case checking
Added more tests to cover corner cases

timeline.author: alzimmermsft
alzimmermsft

replies.bodyText: "null" is a string type in json
replies.author: sima-zhu

timeline.bodyText: Do we have concern that asInt will return int's default of 0 if the JSON value is null?
timeline.author: alzimmermsft

replies.bodyText: Don't know if the service would return this.
replies.author: alzimmermsft

replies.bodyText: Based on the test of null group, service does not return group back if it is null.
replies.author: sima-zhu
